title: How to Make a "Missing to Kissing" Puzzle from a Straw

steps.headline: Draw a face on each of the plastic beads.
Cut a piece of straw 8 -10cm (approximately 4 inches) in length.
Flatten the center of the straw.
steps.description:
Make a hole in the straw that is the same width as the straw (this should be approximately 6mm/0.23" in diameter for a 6mm /0.23"straw) because you will be sliding in the other straw, so the hole needs to be large enough without cutting the straw in two. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fc/MK3_401.JPG/460px-MK3_401.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fc/MK3_401.JPG/760px-MK3_401.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":344,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":568.9560439560439,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} The resulting hole. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/06/MK5_620.JPG/460px-MK5_620.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/06/MK5_620.JPG/760px-MK5_620.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":344,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":568.9560439560439,"licensing":"

Note that the hole has not cut the straw in two! {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2b/MK6_652.JPG/460px-MK6_652.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2b/MK6_652.JPG/760px-MK6_652.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

"}

steps.headline: Cut a piece of string about 50cm (20 inches) long and thread it through the straw first.
steps.description:
Insert another piece of straw through the hole, as shown. You'll need to weave around the thread running through the first straw. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f6/MK6b_164.JPG/460px-MK6b_164.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f6/MK6b_164.JPG/760px-MK6b_164.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"}

steps.headline: Clip down the added length of straw, leaving about 2cm (1 inch) even length on each side of the added straw.
steps.description:
How it now appears from the side. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f5/MK8_173.JPG/460px-MK8_173.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f5/MK8_173.JPG/760px-MK8_173.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":348,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":574.1758241758242,"licensing":"

steps.headline: Add the beads to complete the puzzle creation.
steps.description:
Follow this main diagram if you want to understand the entire structure of the threaded string within the puzzle as you move along threading the string and beads. Thread one bead onto the string. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e7/MK9_4.JPG/460px-MK9_4.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e7/MK9_4.JPG/760px-MK9_4.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} Once the bead is in place, bring this side of the string up and through the small inserted piece of straw that has no string in it yet. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/22/MK10_303.JPG/459px-MK10_303.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/22/MK10_303.JPG/759px-MK10_303.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":344,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":568.9560439560439,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} Wind this piece of string around the two straws as shown in the image (click on image to enlarge if needed). Bring the string under the long straw to one side, then up and over the short straw on one end, and then under the other side of the long straw. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/12/MK11_892.JPG/460px-MK11_892.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/12/MK11_892.JPG/760px-MK11_892.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} Now bring the loose end of string back down through the short piece of straw. As shown in the image, you should now have a circular shape underneath the short straw. Leave the piece of string dangling out at the end as shown. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0c/MK12_250.JPG/460px-MK12_250.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0c/MK12_250.JPG/760px-MK12_250.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} Thread the other bead on to the dangling piece of string. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b0/MK13_39.JPG/460px-MK13_39.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b0/MK13_39.JPG/759px-MK13_39.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":346,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":571.0439560439561,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"} A close-up showing both beads on the string. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6f/MK14_294.JPG/460px-MK14_294.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6f/MK14_294.JPG/760px-MK14_294.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

Image by: Uploader

"}

steps.headline: Tie the loose end that sits just under the second bead up with the piece of string that is coming out of the end of the long straw.
steps.description:
Tie a neat and strong knot so that it won't come apart when trying to do the puzzle. Slide the knot neatly into the long straw so that you don't see it. Adjust the puzzle so that it sits evenly as in this image. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/da/MK16_994.JPG/460px-MK16_994.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/da/MK16_994.JPG/759px-MK16_994.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":344,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":568.9560439560439,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"}

text:
Draw a face on each of the plastic beads. Cut a piece of straw 8 -10cm (approximately 4 inches) in length. Flatten the center of the straw. Make a hole in the straw that is the same width as the straw (this should be approximately 6mm/0.23" in diameter for a 6mm /0.23"straw) because you will be sliding in the other straw, so the hole needs to be large enough without cutting the straw in two. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fc/MK3_401.JPG/460px-MK3_401.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fc/MK3_401.JPG/760px-MK3_401.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":344,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":568.9560439560439,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons
